intro: Daucophyllum lineare, commonly known as the slender hogweed, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in an umbel, typical of the carrot family. Daucophyllum lineare is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has a taproot system and is known for its aromatic properties when crushed.
